l1liuzmtText:
In patients with severe MDD and severe comorbid
GAD, Brintellix® 10-20 mg significantly reduced symptoms
of depression, including anxiety†1
l1liuzn8Text: Comorbid GAD Real-World Data (REVIDA)HAM-A > 20
Brintellix_NewAss_6b53814b3:
• 94% of patients increased the dose of Brintellix® to 20 mg after 1 week of treatment and 87%
maintained this higher dose throughout the study period1
• No clinically relevant difference was observed in AEs in patients who increased to 20 mg
compared to those who stayed on 10 mg1
Brintellix_NewAss_60953bfbd:
†Interventional, open-label effectiveness study of flexible doses of Brintellix® (10-20 mg/day) on depressive and anxiety symptoms in
patients with MDD and comorbid generalised anxiety disorder (GAD). At baseline, patients had severe MDD (MADRS total score = 29.5
points) and severe GAD (HAM-A total score = 28.6 points). 77% had inadequate responses to previous antidepressant treatments.1
Vortioxetine is indicated for the treatment of MDD.2
‡Change in depressive symptoms was measured by assessing the change from baseline in MADRS total score at week 8; baseline: 29.5.
§Change in anxiety symptoms was measured by assessing the change from baseline in HAM-A total score at week 8; at baseline: 28.6.
***p<0.0001 vs baseline.

AEs, adverse events; FAS, full analysis set; GAD, generalised anxiety disorder; HAM-A, Hamilton anxiety rating scale; MADRS, Montgomery–
Åsberg depression rating scale; MDD, major depressive disorder; MDE, major depressive episode; MMRM, mixed-model repeated-measures analysis.
